decks.notes: This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan while applying pressure with aggressive creatures. It uses cards like Fatal Push and Thoughtseize to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The creatures in the deck, such as Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd and Emperor of Bones, are efficient threats that can quickly close out the game. The high amount of removal and disruption spells combined with aggressive creatures create a challenging board state for the opponent to overcome, making it difficult for them to execute their game plan effectively.

The deck focuses on cycling through cards quickly to fill up the graveyard with creatures. It aims to cast Living End, a powerful sorcery that returns all creatures from the graveyard to the battlefield, while also disrupting the opponent's game plan with disruptive creatures like Endurance and Windcaller Aven. The deck utilizes cards like Ardent Plea and Generous Ent to help cycle through the deck and find the necessary pieces to execute the combo. It also includes counter spells like Force of Negation to protect the combo and disrupt the opponent's strategy.

The deck focuses on quickly bringing powerful creatures back from the graveyard to the battlefield using cards like Goryo's Vengeance and Ephemerate. It also includes control elements like Force of Negation and Thoughtseize to disrupt opponents' game plans. By combining instant reanimation with powerful creatures like Griselbrand and Atraxa, Grand Unifier, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with early threats while also having the ability to protect its own game plan. The deck also includes some card draw and removal spells to maintain card advantage and disrupt opponents' strategies.

This Dimir Control deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy while efficiently controlling the game. It includes a mix of counterspells, removal spells, and hand disruption to keep the opponent on their toes. The deck also utilizes creatures like Murktide Regent and Abhorrent Oculus to pressure the opponent while maintaining a strong defensive position. Additionally, the deck features cards like Thought Scour and Shoot the Sheriff to manage the graveyard and further disrupt the opponent's game plan. Overall, this deck aims to outsmart and outlast the opponent through careful resource management and strategic plays.

The central strategy of this deck revolves around controlling the game through a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and powerful creatures like Thundertrap Trainer and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while establishing its own board presence and ultimately winning through sheer card advantage and resource management. By efficiently answering threats and out-valuing the opponent, this Jeskai Control deck seeks to grind out victories in a slow and methodical manner, ensuring that it maintains control of the game from start to finish.

This Jeskai Control deck focuses on controlling the board through removal spells and counterspells while also utilizing card draw and card advantage to outvalue the opponent. The deck aims to stall the game until it can establish a strong board presence with powerful threats such as Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student. The mana base is built to support the three colors of the deck, allowing for flexibility in casting spells and ensuring consistency in gameplay.

The main focus of this Jeskai Control deck is to control the game through counterspells, removal, and card advantage. By utilizing cards like Counterspell, Prismatic Ending, and Supreme Verdict, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan and prevent them from developing a strong board presence. Additionally, the deck includes powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Teferi, Time Raveler to provide additional card advantage and board control. The deck also includes win conditions like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury to close out the game once control has been established.
